author: wsjcom
title: Hedging Bets on Xi Dynasty
text:
China’s new Great Helmsman may have made a bet that the Chinese people will happily accept a cult of personality dictatorship and all that goes with it, as long as the economy keeps growing (“Reckoning With Xi’s Power Play,” by William Galston, Politics & Ideas, March 7). The fact that the elites around Xi Jinping are steadily parking a significant share of their assets and their children in democratic societies suggests that those most in the know have chosen to hedge their bets. History indicates that this is wise.
